{"step_by_step_thinking": "Obstructive jaundice is a condition where there is a blockage in the flow of bile from the liver to the intestines, leading to a buildup of bilirubin in the body. This could be due to a complete obstruction of the common bile duct, which would prevent any bile (and therefore bilirubin) from being excreted from the body.
